Fachrul Razi Minta Ustad Sisipkan Bahasa Indonesia Ketika Berdoa
01 Nov 2019, 08:28 by Dewi Nurita, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi menyisipkan arti bacaan doa dalam bahasa Indonesia saat menyampaikan sejumlah ayat dalam khutbah Jumat di Masjid Istiqlal, Jakarta pada Jumat, 1 November 2019. Saat membaca doa berbahasa Arab pun, Fachrul menyisipkan bahasa Indonesia.
Fachrul meminta caranya tersebut dicontoh dan diadopsi oleh para ustad saat berceramah di masjid, agar jamaah paham maksud doa yang dipanjatkan tersebut.
"Misalnya mengajak Islam yang damai dengan bahasa Arab, belum tentu orang semua paham. Jadi harus ada bahasa Indonesia-nya," ujar Purnawirawan TNI ini saat ditemui usai melaksanakan salat Jumat di Masjid Istiqlal, Jakarta pada Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Menurut Fachrul, ustad-ustad, penceramah atau pemuka agama punya peran penting menjaga kesatuan serta menjaga rumah ibadah tak terpapar paham radikal dan ujaran kebencian.
“Dalam berdoa gunakan, digabung, harus ada bahasa Indonesia agar masyarakat mengerti, karena tidak semua mengerti Bahasa Arab.”

Fachrul Razi Asks Ustad to Insert Indonesian When Praying
01 Nov 2019, 08:28 by Dewi Nurita, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi inserts the meaning of prayer reading in Indonesian when delivering a number of verses in a Friday sermon at Istiqlal Mosque, Jakarta on Friday, November 1, 2019. When reading even Arabic prayer, Fachrul inserts Indonesian.
Fachrul requested that the example be adopted and adopted by the clerics while lecturing at the mosque, so that pilgrims understood the purpose of the prayers.
"For example inviting a peaceful Islam with Arabic, not all people understand. So there must be an Indonesian language," said the retired TNI when met after performing Friday prayers at the Istiqlal Mosque, Jakarta on Friday, November 1, 2019.
According to Fachrul, religious teachers, preachers or religious leaders have an important role to maintain unity and keep houses of worship from being exposed to radical understandings and expressions of hatred.
"In praying to use, to combine, there must be Indonesian so that people understand, because not all understand Arabic."
